Description

The Associate Director, Worldwide Franchise Strategy & Operations is responsible for leading a cross-functional matrix team to streamline and optimize operations and drive market engagement strategies to impact business performance. This individual will focus on developing innovative solutions to simplify operations across the Worldwide Brand Teams (WWBT), identifying inefficiencies, and ensuring solutions are aligned with brand strategy. The individual will work directly with the Worldwide Brand Team and Cross Functional leadership and gain exposure to the local markets across the organization. The role will report directly to the Director, Worldwide Commercial Strategy & Operations and Performance Management, with dotted reporting to the Senior Director, WWC Oncology Strategy & Operations.

Key Responsibilities

  • Strategic thought partner to Brand Leads, identifying opportunities for simplification

  • Plan and facilitate the Unified Strategic Planning (USP) process, including facilitating meetings to develop the strategic summary, disseminate to the markets, and coordinate timelines for USP process

  • Support cross functional brand team meetings as they prepare for Launch

  • Anticipate business needs around key events and proactively develop strategic plans to address needs and facilitate achievement of key decision points

  • Drive commercial component of governance process; Lead the scheduling and development of key presentations within the governance process

  • Summarize knowledge and market learnings for dissemination to markets to enable more efficient launch preparations and quick response to market events for in-market indications

  • Facilitate requests for information from the WWBTs to the markets, with a focus on identifying more efficient knowledge-sharing methods to reduce the workload on the market teams

  • Coordinate and support budgeting process, including projection cycles, annual functional planning, and ad hoc budget requests from leadership

  • Partner with the WWBT to identify opportunities as required to reallocate resources as needed and ensure that the team meets their OpEx budget

  • Support ad-hoc strategic projects as requested by leadership (i.e., Town Halls, Global Interchange, Meetings across Medical, Commercial, and Access to share learnings across the markets leading into key Congresses)

Qualifications:

  • Candidate must have a BA/BS degree or equivalent; MBA is preferred

  • Marketing, Medical, or Operations experience preferred

  • Demonstrated ability to influence stakeholders up, down and across the organization

  • Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced, changing environment with the ability to design and implement multiple projects simultaneously

  • Demonstrated experience in successfully executing projects across multi-functional teams including appropriate business updates and completion within required timeframe

  • Concise and impactful oral and written communication skills

  • Demonstrated strong project management skills

Job Title: Associate Director, US Commercial Real World Data Strategy
Job Description:
Job Description

Working with Us
Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You’ll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .

Description : The Associate Director reports directly to the Director of US Commercial Real World Data Strategy and is based in central NJ. He/She has responsibility for designing and executing the Brand Data Strategies for the pre-launch, launch, and inline brands/indications for a multi-billion-dollar product portfolio. This individual closely collaborates with Marketing, Legal, Patient Services, Market Access/Trade, Procurement, IT/EIM, Business Insights & Analytics (BI&A) Matrix teams, and other functions within BMS.  The ideal candidate will consider the strategic and operational impacts of their work in planning, identifying, acquiring, and utilizing commercial data sources and technologies to generate business impact through enhanced insights and analytics.

Key Responsibilities and Major Duties

Leadership and Project Management

  • Lead a therapy-focused team of employees, contractors, and multiple on-shore and offshore analytics consultants to support the data needs of Marketing, Sales, Patient Support, Market Access/Trade, and Business Insight & Analytics.

  • Enable Business Insights & Analytics matrix team members to execute impactful analytics by highlighting existing and acquiring new, fit-for purpose data sets.

  • Manage multiple complex projects simultaneously and deliver results in a timely manner. Prioritize efforts across portfolio, focusing on maximizing business value.

  • Mentor and train new or existing team members and BI&A colleagues.

  • Drive the annual functional planning efforts in support of the budget process with Finance and Brand teams.

Data Strategy

  • Establish Data Strategy and implement Data Models for launch products, in alignment with Brand and Commercialization strategies.

  • Monitor rapidly evolving data marketplace, identifying, evaluating and acquiring new data sources, and forging new partnerships in support of enhancing BMS’s competitive capabilities.

  • Oversee management of data contracts (MSA’s, SOW’s) with new and existing data vendors. Creates data SOW’s in alignment with approved budget, amend, monitor and terminate contracts as required. Negotiate data contracts and deliverables with third party data providers.

Business Value

  • Partner with Brand leaders to synthesize key business questions, develop hypothetical solutions, analyze their feasibility, and execute acquisition of data assets in support of commercial strategy. Ensure alignment of data needs, quality, timelines, deliverables and costs.

  • Develop deep understanding of covered disease states, treatment landscapes, and market access.  Translate knowledge into illustrative patient journeys and analytics to uncover gaps, build competitive advantages and highlight opportunities for efficiencies.

  • Collaborate with Matrix partners for patient opportunity identification data analysis and lead Physician level Alert generation to support field sales team call planning.

  • Lead performance tracking work streams to support non-commercial data uses including patient access and support services.  Provide guidance on appropriate use of data and metrics.

Data Quality, Privacy and Protection

  • Work closely with Legal, Privacy, Strategic Corporate Transactions, and Data Protection Office to ensure appropriate protections are in place for privacy, regulatory and contractual compliance.

  • Continuously gather data and technology insights to identify gaps in quality, capabilities, and coverage. Formulate and execute solutions to address identified gaps.

  • Serve as point of escalation for team to resolve data quality and invoice issues.

Qualifications and Competencies

  • Bachelor’s degree/MBA/MS plus 5+ years experience preferred

  • Proven leadership in the pharmaceutical and/or healthcare industry. Understanding of analytical and insight generation approaches in the biopharma industry including descriptive and predictive analytics, business intelligence and reporting, primary market research and competitive intelligence.

  • Ability to draw inferences from disparate pieces of data, identify key findings, link to implications and provide recommendations in a digestible and business-friendly format

  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills, including the ability to work with diverse teams across organizational lines and structures and negotiate with stakeholders.

  • Broad knowledge of secondary pharmaceutical data sources such as Retail & Non-Retail data, Medical & Pharmacy Claims, EMR, Lab Test/Diagnostics, Chart Audits, Patient Hub & Specialty Pharmacy Data, 852/867 EDI and Health System/Payer – Plan hierarchies. Operational experience with Specialty Pharmacy data and data aggregation.

  • Deep understanding of data use cases in pharma/biopharma/healthcare including patient journey, performance management, targeting, market sizing & segmentation, customer affiliation, field alignment. and incentive compensation. Familiarity with emerging Analytics / Data Science capabilities and their application to healthcare / life sciences.

  • Knowledge of therapeutic areas, preferably Oncology, Hematology, Immunology, Neuroscience, or Cardiovascular.

  • Experience with creation and presentation of business cases as well as business rule documentation.

  • Experience managing contracts and vendors as well as familiarity with procurement processes.

  • Proficiency in data analytics tools such as Excel, SQL, SAS, Alteryx, MicroStrategy & Tableau.

  • Understanding of healthcare related regulations and their impacts on healthcare data usage.

Job Title: Clinical Nurse Consultant, San Francisco, CA
Job Description:
Job Description

Working with Us
Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You’ll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .

As part of the commercial organization, the Clinical Nurse Consultant (CNC) is a trusted clinical expert responsible for developing professional relationships and educating key Health Care Professionals (HCP) involved in the care of patients receiving BMS hematology products in a defined geography.

Incumbent must reside in territory advertised.

  • The primary role of the CNC is to drive peer to peer interactions with customers that optimize patient outcomes by delivering end-to-end clinical exchanges that clarify the complexities of patient identification and management.
  • The purpose of these interactions is to deliver a continuum of clinical education and support that address the needs of HCPs starting or continuing patients on BMS hematology medicines, optimizing patient management and duration of treatment.  CNCs also educate on unmet disease needs and discuss the current treatment landscape for these patient populations.  CNC interactions are aligned with on-label commercial strategies and the needs expressed by customers.
  • CNCs develop relationships with hematology focused Patient Support Groups for the purpose of presenting approved presentations that address specific patient education needs identified by the group leader.
  • CNCs are viewed as clinical experts by their customers for the BMS hematology portfolio and are responsible for REBLOZYL (MDS), ONUREG (AML), POMALYST & REVLIMID (MM), ABECMA & BREYANZI (CAR-T).  Product responsibilities may change based on franchise and business needs.

Customer Focus

  • Develop and maintain relationships with academic and community HCPs within assigned geography to provide on-label clinical and product education for BMS hematology products. The CNC will use various channels for interactions (1:1, group presentations, remote, etc.) while utilizing on-label approved marketing materials.
  • Actively assess the treatment and patient management landscape by meeting with HCPs to understand their needs and current patient management processes/protocols.
  • Demonstrate proficiency in using available on-label CNC resources and presentations. Effectively utilize platform skills for presenting information to HCPs and be able to respond to questions, ensuring accuracy and compliance with local procedures, ethical and legal guidelines and directives.
  • Consistently evaluate the impact of CNC activities in an account and plan for follow-up or next steps.
  • Respond and adapt quickly to support new and ongoing educational gaps or other customer needs.
  • Actively monitor CNC dashboard & account data, adjusting activities and business plans to meet goals and objectives.
  • Continuously seek to increase knowledge of treatment landscape, product attributes and disease states. Actively prepare to address the educational needs of customers.

Provide Clinical Expertise

  • In collaboration with sales partners, deliver on-label promotional speaker programs to HCP customers in approved out of office settings.
  • In collaboration with sales partners, deliver on-label promotional in-services for HCP customers.
  • Provide product demonstrations and infusion support for CAR T sites starting new patients.
  • Support initial and ongoing clinical/disease area and product specific training to internal stakeholders (e.g. Commercial, Value Access & Payment).
  • Participate in assigned Medical Congress activities.
  • Share clinical insights and patient management experiences internally to support franchise strategy.

Commercial Planning and Execution

  • Adopt account business planning approach and contribute to cross-functional business plans.
  • Collaborate with peers and cross-functional partners to successfully execute Hematology franchise performance goals and metrics.
  • Assist with the development of clinically meaningful CNC programs/projects in line with commercial strategies and plans.

Required Qualifications and Experience

  • APP (DNP, NP), MSN, BSN with a minimum of 5 years clinical experience in a Hematology/Oncology Disease Area.
  • Nurse Educator experience within the bio/pharmaceutical industry preferred
  • Current active Nursing or PA licensure
  • Clinical depth within Hematology and Cell Therapy including AML, Lymphoma, MDS, and Myeloma

Behaviors and Competencies Desired:

  • Strong business acumen that leads to plans and execution aligned with business priorities
  • Advanced impactful communication skills, including effective presentation platform skills
  • Experience effectively transferring clinical expertise to others and influencing patient management processes/protocols
  • Collaboration skills that lead to meaningful partnerships with other internal functions
  • Established relationships with health care providers within assigned geography
  • Demonstrates BMS Values

Essential Qualifications

  • This field-based role requires frequent travel (approximately 50-75% of time) and HCP interactions in multiple public settings. Candidates must be willing and able to fly and drive within and out of their territory to meet business needs.
  • A company car is provided and candidates must have a valid state-issued driver’s license and clear driving record.
  • Candidates must have the ability to work nights & weekends as needed.
  • Candidates must operate in compliance with all laws, regulations, and policies.

For position offered in California, the starting compensation for Clinical Nurse Consultant job is a range from [$138,000-$163,000). plus incentive cash and stock opportunities (based on eligibility). The starting pay takes into account characteristics of the job, such as required skills and where the job is performed. Final, individual compensation is decided based on demonstrated experience. For more on benefits, please visit our BMS Careers site. Eligibility for specific benefits listed in our careers site may vary based on the job and location.

Job Title: Regional Associate Director, Clinical Nurse Consultants, Central Region (OH, IN, MI, MN, WI)
Job Description:
Job Description

Working with Us
Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You’ll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .

Associate Director, Clinical Nurse Consultant

The Clinical Nurse Consultant (CNC) Associate Director is the leader of a US field-based team of nurses who function as an extension of the US Commercial organization.

The CNC-Associate is responsible for leading and managing the efforts of the CNCs within their designated Region. W orking with the National Director and VP of Hematology, the CNC Associate Director provides operational support for executing the CNC strategy and delivering on the annual objectives and initiatives. The CNC-Associate Director develops and oversees key CNC programs regionally and nationally. The strategic customer segments of focus include RN, APP, Patient & Caregiver.

The incumbent must reside in one of the states advertised.

Business Savvy and Organizational Agility

  • Engage and align with key organizational stakeholders on role of the Clinical Nurse Consultant in achieving Hematology organizational priorities
  • Engage and align with Hematology Marketing Franchise team on objectives, priorities, and CNC resource needs
  • Represent CNC organization on cross functional U.S. launch teams
  • Collaborate with Market Access teams to develop innovative solutions to meet customer needs
  • Liaise with Patient Advocacy team to develop innovative solutions to meet patient needs
  • Appropriately partner with Marketing and Regional Sales Directors, as well as Market Access Leadership to define Clinical Nurse Consultant role in supporting account specific objectives
  • Define strategy to meet CNC educational resource objectives
  • Identify and remove operational barriers to team effectiveness
  • Appropriately partner with the commercial field team and commercial training to provide disease and product education in the region and corresponding districts
  • Engage key customers to define opportunities for collaboration and impact
  • Connect with key customers and External Experts to continuously seek customer feedback on opportunities to positively impact patient health
  • Plan and manage the CNC booth presence at key Nursing Conferences
  • Collaborate with SP & DA (Operations) partners to evaluate existing analytics capabilities, develop additional tools to identify trends and secure resources that meet account educational needs
  • Provide advanced analytical regional analysis at a regional level
  • Assume responsibility for coordination and management of scope, content and timelines for CNC initiated projects with third party vendors and marketing partners

Communication Skills

  • Engage the team on CNC purpose and mission
  • Actively support the regional team and their efforts by being their advocate and spokesperson; promote collaboration within the team, across work groups and with customers
  • Develop and maintain productive and appropriate relationships with individuals in other regional/field-based positions from the commercial and medical affairs organizations
  • Promote open dialogue with cross functional partners by providing key insights and consistency

Influential Leadership Across All Levels of the Organization

  • Provide leadership to the CNC team and enable successful delivery of program objectives
  • Partner with legal/compliance to provide functional expertise that shapes CNC policies and procedures
  • Lead in the development and execution of Account Education plans that align with the CNC priorities/objectives and Regional opportunities for Nursing & APP customer segments
  • Applies a globally relevant customer centric mindset when interpreting trends and evaluating future opportunities; able to apply relevant information to develop plans that positively impact customers
  • Provides and maintains developmental plans for all team members

Managerial Courage and Accountability

  • Establish relevant success metrics and ensure team clarity and accountability in meeting and/or exceeding stated objectives/metrics
  • Oversee recruiting, staffing, hiring, training and developmental opportunities for assigned CNC Region
  • Ensure CNC team receives clear guidance and is compliant with all appropriate regulations and company SOPs and has right level of direction and training to ensure compliance, inclusive of first line monitoring
  • Provide ongoing coaching and guidance to respective CNCs, enabling high team engagement and performance

Ongoing Professional Development

  • Create a positive and engaging work environment that rewards accomplishments and encourages the advancement and retention of productive employees.
  • Guide/assist CNCs in developing and executing outreach and education strategies for their individual geographies
  • Develop and continuously evaluate/update CNC team and CNC manager competencies
  • Proactively plan for core competency development for self and team
  • Create objectives, content, and mobilize resources to execute POA and CNC Annual Meeting workshops
  • Develop objectives, agenda and content for Regional Meetings
  • Foster a continuous learning environment and ensure individuals are given opportunity to develop outside of their core responsibilities/competencies.  Provide follow-up feedback and communication regarding development opportunities

Experience Required:

  • 10 years of related nursing experience with an oncology background (hematology preferred)
  • 5 years of pharmaceutical industry experience (field based preferred)
  • Prior nurse management or team leadership (pharmaceutical industry preferred)
  • Excellent communication, both written and verbal; must be adaptable and able to work well within a matrixed structure and relate effectively with people at all levels of the organization
  • Able to inspire a team to excel by fostering a climate of energy, excitement and personal accountability
  • Demonstrated leadership in ambiguous situations
  • Established customer engagement skills
  • Demonstrated ability to resolve conflict in a productive and respectful manner
  • Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional leadership across Sales, Market Access, Marketing and broader organization
  • Experience with developing roles/responsibilities for Nurse/Clinical Educator team
  • High level of integrity and dependability
  • Current working knowledge of US legal, regulatory, and compliance regulations and guidelines
  • Excellent computer skills i.e. Microsoft office, Excel, Power point

Education Required:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Nursing (Master’s degree preferred)

Travel required.  Must be able to work nights and weekends. Ability to travel overnight up to 50% of the time

For position offered in California, the starting compensation for Regional Associate Director, Clinical Nurse Consultants job is a range from [$160,000-$190,000). plus incentive cash and stock opportunities (based on eligibility). The starting pay takes into account characteristics of the job, such as required skills and where the job is performed. Final, individual compensation is decided based on demonstrated experience. For more on benefits, please visit our BMS Careers site. Eligibility for specific benefits listed in our careers site may vary based on the job and location.

Job Title: Clinical Nurse Consultant, San Diego, CA
Job Description:
Job Description

Working with Us
Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You’ll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .

As part of the commercial organization, the Clinical Nurse Consultant (CNC) is a trusted clinical expert responsible for developing professional relationships and educating key Health Care Professionals (HCP) involved in the care of patients receiving BMS hematology products in a defined geography.

  • The primary role of the CNC is to drive peer to peer interactions with customers that optimize patient outcomes by delivering end-to-end clinical exchanges that clarify the complexities of patient identification and management.
  • The purpose of these interactions is to deliver a continuum of clinical education and support that address the needs of HCPs starting or continuing patients on BMS hematology medicines, optimizing patient management and duration of treatment.  CNCs also educate on unmet disease needs and discuss the current treatment landscape for these patient populations.  CNC interactions are aligned with on-label commercial strategies and the needs expressed by customers.
  • CNCs develop relationships with hematology focused Patient Support Groups for the purpose of presenting approved presentations that address specific patient education needs identified by the group leader.
  • CNCs are viewed as clinical experts by their customers for the BMS hematology portfolio and are responsible for REBLOZYL (MDS), ONUREG (AML), POMALYST & REVLIMID (MM), ABECMA & BREYANZI (CAR-T).  Product responsibilities may change based on franchise and business needs.

Customer Focus

  • Develop and maintain relationships with academic and community HCPs within assigned geography to provide on-label clinical and product education for BMS hematology products. The CNC will use various channels for interactions (1:1, group presentations, remote, etc.) while utilizing on-label approved marketing materials.
  • Actively assess the treatment and patient management landscape by meeting with HCPs to understand their needs and current patient management processes/protocols.
  • Demonstrate proficiency in using available on-label CNC resources and presentations. Effectively utilize platform skills for presenting information to HCPs and be able to respond to questions, ensuring accuracy and compliance with local procedures, ethical and legal guidelines and directives.
  • Consistently evaluate the impact of CNC activities in an account and plan for follow-up or next steps.
  • Respond and adapt quickly to support new and ongoing educational gaps or other customer needs.
  • Actively monitor CNC dashboard & account data, adjusting activities and business plans to meet goals and objectives.
  • Continuously seek to increase knowledge of treatment landscape, product attributes and disease states. Actively prepare to address the educational needs of customers.

Provide Clinical Expertise

  • In collaboration with sales partners, deliver on-label promotional speaker programs to HCP customers in approved out of office settings.
  • In collaboration with sales partners, deliver on-label promotional in-services for HCP customers.
  • Provide product demonstrations and infusion support for CAR T sites starting new patients.
  • Support initial and ongoing clinical/disease area and product specific training to internal stakeholders (e.g. Commercial, Value Access & Payment).
  • Participate in assigned Medical Congress activities.
  • Share clinical insights and patient management experiences internally to support franchise strategy.

Commercial Planning and Execution

  • Adopt account business planning approach and contribute to cross-functional business plans.
  • Collaborate with peers and cross-functional partners to successfully execute Hematology franchise performance goals and metrics.
  • Assist with the development of clinically meaningful CNC programs/projects in line with commercial strategies and plans.

Required Qualifications and Experience

  • APP (DNP, NP), MSN, BSN with a minimum of 5 years clinical experience in a Hematology/Oncology Disease Area.
  • Nurse Educator experience within the bio/pharmaceutical industry preferred
  • Current active Nursing or PA licensure
  • Clinical depth within Hematology and Cell Therapy including AML, Lymphoma, MDS, and Myeloma

Behaviors and Competencies Desired:

  • Strong business acumen that leads to plans and execution aligned with business priorities
  • Advanced impactful communication skills, including effective presentation platform skills
  • Experience effectively transferring clinical expertise to others and influencing patient management processes/protocols
  • Collaboration skills that lead to meaningful partnerships with other internal functions
  • Established relationships with health care providers within assigned geography
  • Demonstrates BMS Values

Essential Qualifications

  • This field-based role requires frequent travel (approximately 50-75% of time) and HCP interactions in multiple public settings. Candidates must be willing and able to fly and drive within and out of their territory to meet business needs.
  • A company car is provided and candidates must have a valid state-issued driver’s license and clear driving record.
  • Candidates must have the ability to work nights & weekends as needed.
  • Candidates must operate in compliance with all laws, regulations, and policies.

For position offered in California, the starting compensation for Clinical Nurse Consultant job is a range from [$138,000-$163,000). plus incentive cash and stock opportunities (based on eligibility). The starting pay takes into account characteristics of the job, such as required skills and where the job is performed. Final, individual compensation is decided based on demonstrated experience. For more on benefits, please visit our BMS Careers site. Eligibility for specific benefits listed in our careers site may vary based on the job and location.

Job Description:
Job Description

Working with Us
Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. The Director, Cell Therapy Decision Engine Business Intelligence is responsible for creating an end-to-end analytics solution to automate decisions and actions for cell therapy. This will enable the use of integrated data to optimize and automate business processes and outcomes through decision intelligence for predictive monitoring, real time analysis and decision making.

  • Create end-to-end analytics solutions (acquire, integrate, and transform various data, develop production reporting pipelines, develop front-end BI tools (e.g Tableau, Power-BI, etc.)
  • Analytics thought-leader and Subject Matter Expert for your domain and influence organization decisions through providing data-driven recommendations verbally or in writing
  • Focuses on complex and/or ambiguous problem areas in existing or new BI initiatives
  • Take the long term view of your team's solutions and how they fit into the team’s architecture
  • Take the lead on large projects that require the work of multiple persons
  • Established good working relationships with teammates and peers
  • Operational Excellence, code reviews, syntax and naming convention, metric definitions, alarms) and set standards
  • Work to resolve the root cause(s) of pervasive or persistent problems; your efforts may unblock related teams
  • Role model BMS behaviors of Accountability, Passion, Urgency, Innovation, Inclusion, and Integrity

Experience :

  • 5+ years of delivering results managing a business intelligence or analytics team, including employee development and performance management experience
  • Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
  • Experience with R, Python, Weka, SAS, Matlab or other statistical/machine learning software
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, business, economics, math, finance, or similar fields
  • 10+ years of technical management in Data, Analytics and Business Intelligence
  • 5+ years of experience in building and operating large-scale technology systems
  • 4+ years of working with very large data warehousing environment experience
  • 10+ years of data warehouse technical architectures, data modeling, infrastructure components, ETL/ ELT and reporting/analytic tools and environments, data structures and hands-on SQL coding experience

    The starting compensation for this job is a range from $182,000 - $229,000, plus incentive cash and stock opportunities (based on eligibility). The starting pay rate takes into account characteristics of the job, such as required skills and the geographic location where work is performed. Final, individual compensation is decided commensurate with demonstrated experience. For more on benefits, please visit our BMS Careers Site. Eligibility for specific benefits listed therein may vary based on job and location.

Job Title: Senior Director, Worldwide Medical Immunology and Neuroscience, Cendakimab
Job Description:
Job Description

Working with Us
Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You’ll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .

Position Summary

The Global Cendakimab lead is responsible for developing and executing the medical affairs strategy across markets and will be responsible for launch planning and execution. This leader will be a core member of the Worldwide Medical Immunology & Neuroscience Medical Leadership team and report directly to the SVP of Worldwide Medical Immunology and Neuroscience.

Role and Responsibilities

• Be the medical leader for Cendakimab medical affairs, leading and developing direct reports in the Cendakimab medical team.
• As lead of the Cendakimab WW medical affairs team, will represent global medical affairs in cross functional leadership forums.
• Develop, communicate, and execute the medical strategy plan for Cendakimab worldwide.
• Responsible for requesting and managing medical budget to ensure execution to defined targets.
• Lead regional medical affairs strategies in conjunction with clinical development, market access and commercial colleagues with focus on Major Markets and Intercontinental.
• Provide ongoing expertise to execute on congress strategy, field medical plans, home office training, execution of TL plan and other medical strategies.
• Provides expert opinion on the current trends in the pathophysiology, diagnosis, existing and emerging treatment options as well as unmet medical needs in eosinophilic gastrointestinal disorders to inform key medical and business decisions.
• Provide medical support to the WW medical affairs organization, including developing and delivering training curriculum and content for market field medical associates.
• Develop and execute the medical data generation plan, Phase 4 and ISR planning, delivery of publication plan and establishing BMS as a leader in the therapeutic space.
• Develop and maintain strong relationships with WW key opinion leaders, key professional societies, and organizations in collaboration with other global medical affairs functions and clinical colleagues through scientific dialogue pertinent to BMS I&F interest. Lead and participate in WW advisory meetings with WW opinion leaders.

Required Qualifications & Experience

• M.D., D.O., PhD, PharmD or equivalent degree, with minimum 10+ years experience in the pharma/biopharma industry with demonstrated medical affairs experience in EU / WW markets
• Minimum 4 years of medical affairs (WW or US) specific experience in Immunology.
• Direct gastroenterology or launch experience is ideal
• Excellent written and oral communication skills, including strong formal presentation skills
• Excellent planning and organization skills
• Strong interpersonal skills commensurate with the need to work closely with both external physicians/scientists and numerous in-house support groups
• Ability to maintain the highest degree of confidentiality and integrity, represent the company’s high ethics, moral behavior, and professionalism
• Demonstrated ability to maintain scientific credibility while executing the Medical Affairs plan, and to communicate scientific results and effectively respond to data queries from customers and/or consultants
• Strong scientific analytical skills
• Ability to work under pressure, and to maintain scientific excellence within timelines
• Ability to global travel (frequent travel will be required)

Job Title: Non-Required Learning & Experience Platform Lead
Job Description:
Job Description

Working with Us
Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You’ll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .

The non-required LMS (Learning Management System) and Experience Application Owner ensures that the non-required learning system (Sana) aligns with organizational goals, enhances the overall BMS learning experience, and meets enterprise learning needs for the learning professional and the learner. This is a crucial role in driving successful implementation governance and utilization of the system across the organization as a core element to our learning technology ecosystem.

Serves as the System Business Owner, subject matter expert (SME), and advocate for the enterprise learning experience. Their primary objective is to achieve business goals, enhance learner experience, and drive process and administrative standardization, sustainability, scalability, and simplification of the platform.

This individual plays a critical role in the organization by overseeing the strategic direction of the non-required learning platform (Sana) to meet Enterprise Learning goals. This individual will partner and collaborate closely with the HRIT DCM as Technical System Owner, Content Integrity team within Enterprise Learning Services (ELS), as well as various functional teams; ensuring efficient resource utilization within the application and driving continuous improvement by identifying areas for enhancement to optimize the platform to distribute and engage with learning.

Key Responsibilities and Major Duties

  • System Owner, Subject Matter Expert (SME), Business Partnering

  • System Ownership & Decision Making. Serves as the primary decision-maker, business contact, and accountable individual for the Sana platform as well as defines the system’s vision, goals, and roadmap aligned to organizational objectives. Drive standardization, sustainability, and scalability for the Sana platform.

  • Data Custodian & Data Integrity ensuring quality, accuracy, and consistency within the platform. Collaborate with appropriate data governance teams and workers councils.

  • Create and maintain training materials, resources, and support for the platform.

  • Supports capability demonstrations and knowledge transfer of platform to other ELS team members, and relevant stakeholders.

  • Lead projects on behalf of Enterprise Learning Services (ELS) team, in support of all learning stakeholders and in partnership with HRIT for the Sana platform.

  • Escalation point for critical issues or decisions to senior leaders when necessary.

  • Characterize the needs of stakeholders and develop an applicable change management plan for any changes, upgrades, or integrations (through M&A or BAU) with the Sana platform.

  • Creation, maintenance, communication, and training on standard operating procedures and best practices for the Sana platform.

  • Support Functional Digital Learning Solutions Partner(s) in ELS to consult/coordinate work with internal and external resources in the utilization of the Sana platform.

  • Partner with and influence senior learning and functional leaders in addition to their reporting structures to drive organizational commitment, adoption, and utilization of the Sana platform per enterprise standards and best practices.

  • Align with Functional Digital Learning Solutions Partner(s) to ensure Sana is meeting business needs and standards are being adhered to for content development, tagging, storage, and assignment/deployment.

  • Collaborate closely with and provide direction to content development vendor partner(s) to assist with content-related deployment, operations, or service issues and/or requests.

  • Provide escalation support for platform or content issues deployed through the Sana platform (Tier II).

  • Lead business requirements gathering for any changes related to Sana.

  • Partner with HRIT to create and maintain a yearly roadmap for platform investment and improvement to meet enterprise needs.

  • Partner with HRIT to ensure Sana is available to appropriate local or global audiences and all required Security & Data Privacy reviews are followed.

  • Develop UAT approach and Lead UAT of system upgrades and projects.

  • Partner with ELS team and business for annual learning content and platform review and audit.

  • Partner with procurement for vendor team member’s onboarding, performance, and capability enhancement, if vendor utilization is applicable.

  • Author myBMS knowledge capital in support of self-service model as applicable.

  • Chair applicable internal forums (i.e., Sana Enhancement Board) for the Sana platform on inclusive involvement across enterprise learning groups to support knowledge dissemination and change pull-through.

  • Partners with Vendor(s), BU learning leaders, PSLT, Learning Council, Finance, HRIT, HRBPs, COE organization as and when needed to maintain and improve learning operations and ensure enterprise learning needs are met.

List of minimum requirements

  • BA/BS degree required

  • 5+ years of professional experience in pharma IT, working as a learning technology system owner, contributing to business strategy and operations.

  • Ability to influence and serve as a trusted partner to business and matrix partners

  • Ability to think strategically and drive strategic planning across stakeholders

  • Demonstrated strong project management skills, including managing timelines, budgets, stakeholders, and deliverable development

  • Experience engaging with and driving technology-supported (i.e., IT) initiatives

  • Demonstrated ability to design, develop and support the implementation of enterprise, global processes and technologies

  • Ability to effectively communicate and interact with internal and external clients from all levels, and to facilitate discussions

  • Experience in designing, developing, and delivering learning platforms and operational processes

  • Ability to set objectives, monitor and achieve for performance, and ensure high level of engagement and commitment

  • Demonstrates ability to work effectively in complex, fast paced environment with competing priorities.

  • Demonstrates ability to manage multiple, broad scope, complex learning initiatives using both internal and external resources

  • Customer service oriented.  Excellent interpersonal skills with a proven ability to work and communicate effectively with all levels of non-technical users, managers, directors, and executive leadership in a creative, matrix organization

  • Passionate about their work and understands how it fits into the business operations

  • Able to translate business requirements into workable solutions and solve potentially complex problems

  • Knowledge and experience in Instructional Design methodologies is preferred.

  • Superior attention to details, problem solver, strong organizational skills

  • Microsoft Office Suite, SharePoint, Customer Relationship Management (CRM) tools (i.e.: ServiceNow, SalesForce)

Working Conditions

  • Travel Required (nature and frequency) - 10%

  • Overnight Absences Required (per typical month) -Approximately 3-5 days per quarter

Job Title: Associate Director, Finance Resource Management - ICN
Job Description:
Job Description

Working with Us
Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You’ll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .

Position Summary

The Finance Resource Management - ICN role is an Associate Director role that collaborates with Global Program Teams (GPT) and other support functions.  The Associate Director serves as the day-to-day contact for all financial needs of the assigned assets and will be primarily responsible for the financial management of early and late phase assets within Immunology. The candidate is expected to drive financial close/projection and governance support for assigned assets.

Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Financial support of subset of early and late phase assets, including portfolio forecasting and governance support
  • Develop business cases, cost plans and financial insights to assist senior leadership in making sound investment decisions
  • Support monthly/quarterly accounting review and financial close for ongoing studies
  • Responsible to achieve financial goals and elevate issues proactively, timely, and transparently
  • Support integration of multiple platforms/systems and processes and lead analytical improvements
  • Financial support and management of business development and cost sharing collaborations with other pharmaceutical partners, as applicable
  • Contribute to creation of a high-performance culture through effective leadership and communication with key stakeholders in the cross-functional organization
  • Articulate a vision for the finance function and communicate a supporting strategy with clarity, force and impact to align people, critical resources, management and stakeholders
  • Support and lead process changes that continuously adapt to a dynamic business environment
  • Learn from experience and apply those learnings to enhance performance
  • Business-partnering with various Project Management, Clinical Operations and Global Program Team members to provide clarity and transparency to the portfolio evolution

Qualifications & Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in finance or accounting, CPA or MBA preferred
  • Minimum 7-10 years’ experience in finance or accounting
  • Previous pharmaceutical or related industry experience desirable
  • Strong financial and analytical skills as well as excellent business-partnering abilities required
  • Strong working knowledge of R&D Financial, Planning and/or CTMS systems is preferred
  • Effective communication skills, strong oral and written communications a must
  • The successful candidate will be a self-starter, highly motivated, customer focused and able to make decisions independently
  • Collaboration experience, inside and outside of finance is desirable
  • Experience working with multiple levels of management with competing demands on time

Key Capabilities of Focus:

  • Leadership : Will lean on ability to solve programs alongside business partners, in part by “listening to understand”
  • Collaboration: Successful candidate will have ability to clearly communicate and story-tell; will also need strong cross-matrix partnership skills and ability to influence and drive effective decision making
  • Financial Literacy: Strong business forecasting and scenario analysis skills, with an understanding of key accounting and reporting needs
  • Business Acumen: This role requires strong and proven business partnering capabilities and ability to identify risks and opportunities

Job Description

Title: Director, Global Cell Therapy, Strategy & Operations

Location: Princeton Pike or Summit, New Jersey

At Bristol Myers Squibb we are reimagining the future of cell therapy . With our bold ambition, backed by a best-in-the-industry team and long-term commitment, we are leading the way to unlock the full promise of cell therapy as we strive to put more patients on the path to a cure. If you are ready to challenge yourself, accelerate your career, and give new hope to patients, there’s no better place than here at BMS with our Cell Therapy team.

The Director, Global Cell Therapy (CT), Strategy & Operations (Abecma, Breyanzi and GPRC5D) will act as a critical and trusted thought partner to the Vice Presidents / Global Brand leads and their teams. Abecma, Breyanzi and GPRC5D are foundational assets to the Cell Therapy Organization (CTO). Abecma was the first BCMA targeted CAR T approved for relapsed refractory multiple myeloma, recently FDA approved for patients in after two or more prior lines of therapy. Breyanzi is a best-in-class CD19 targeted CAR T approved for large B-cell lymphoma (LBCL), chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) and follicular lymphoma (FL), with several additional indications on the horizon. GPRC5D is a novel target for multiple myeloma, and BMS has a robust clinical development program for this asset.

T he role will report to the Executive Director, CT Head of Strategy and Operations. They will provide strategic and/or operational expert consultation to the brand leads, GPTs and GTM to shape and advance key brand or cross-functional initiatives. The incumbent will manage brand specific governance to streamline and optimize operations to enhance efficiency and will play an important role in functional planning, budget management and coordination of governance readiness. The Director will also be project managing important initiatives, including coordination of launch preparation and market interface meetings.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Strategic thought partner to Brand Leads to provide strategic and/or operational expert consultation to enhance value of Global teams deliverables to markets and for process & governance simplification
  • Anticipate business needs around key milestones and proactively provides strategic recommendation or develop implementation plan to ensure successful achievement of milestone
  • Lead ad-hoc strategic projects to ensure optimal value generation for WW cross-functional and in-market teams (i.e., Global/In-Market Interchange, Global/In-Market best practice sharing meetings…)
  • Plan and facilitate the Unified Strategic Planning (USP) process, including facilitating meetings to develop the strategic summary, disseminate to the markets, and coordinate timelines for USP process
  • Drive commercial component of governance process; Lead the scheduling and development of key presentations within the governance process
  • Coordinate and support budgeting process, including projection cycles, annual functional planning, and ad hoc budget requests from leadership
  • Identify opportunities for simplification, apply appropriate level of rigor, propose solutions, and lead implementation across teams and functions.


Qualifications & Experience:

  • BA/BS required. MBA, PharmD, or other graduate degree strongly preferred
  • 8-10+ years combined commercial experience across related disciplines, Global and/or local Marketing, BI&A or strategic management consulting experiences
  • Strong knowledge of biopharmaceutical industry; possesses a global understanding of end-to-end drug development, manufacturing, and commercialization processes; relevant experience in Cell Therapy is preferable
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and design, manage or implement multiple projects simultaneously
  • Strong diagnostic and strategic thinking skills and demonstrated ability to contribute to shaping strategy and translating to execution
  • Results driven, with excellent organizational, analytical, and planning skills
  • Concise and impactful oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to work with cross-functional, matrixed teams, maintaining strong relationships and influencing outcomes

Why You Should Apply:


Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.

Job Description:
Job Description

Working with Us
Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. Position Summary

The Technical Director, Supply Chain Solution Architecture will be responsible for designing and implementing supply chain planning solutions using SAP S/4, Kinaxis Rapid Response, and/or IBP that meet the needs of our business. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in supply chain planning along with demonstrated solution architecture and implementation experience using these or similar tools and technologies.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, implement, and operate supply chain planning solutions and strategies utilizing SAP S/4, Kinaxis Rapid Response, and IBP that align with the company's supply chain goals/needs.
  • Lead and collaborate with cross-functional teams to architect, design, build, manage, and operate solution delivering business value.
  • Lead and collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather, understand, and share requirements as necessary to architect, design, and implement solutions.
  • Develop and maintain solution architecture documentation, including diagrams, specifications, and other technical documentation.
  • Provide technical guidance and support to development teams during the implementation of supply chain planning solutions.
  • Ensure that solutions are scalable, reliable, and maintainable while adhering to applicable policies and procedures.
  • Stay current with emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices in the supply chain planning solution space.  Recommend complementary and/or new solutions as appropriate.


Qualifications & Experience

Required:

  • 10+ years of experience in an information technology related field delivering and supporting supply chain planning, with at least 5 years focused on solution architecture and implementation.
  • Exceptional understanding of supply chain planning processes including demand planning, supply planning, inventory management, production planning, and S&OP including statistical forecasting MRP, allocation, scheduling, and constraint planning.
  • Demonstrated experience with configuration of workbooks, key figures, master data, and planning parameters along with heuristic and optimized planning algorithms.
  • Demonstrated subject matter expertise in SAP S/4, Oracle EBS or equivalent ERP system and Kinaxis Rapid Response, SAP IBP, or equivalent planning system.
  • Demonstrated success in designing, delivering, and supporting integrated planning solutions using disparate technologies.
  • Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and resolve complex technical issues.
  • Excellent project management and organizational skills.
  • Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills.

Ideal Candidates Would Also Have:

  • Experience working internationally with a globally dispersed team including management of offshore technical development team(s).
  • Exceptional understanding of supply chain planning processes related to capacity and material allocation in a constrained environment.
  • Exposure to data integration approaches and technologies connecting SAP S/4 with and other non-SAP systems.
  • Prior experience working in a global life sciences supply chain planning environment.
  • Prior experience working in a supply chain planning environment supporting Cell Therapy.

#LI-Hybrid

Job Title: Sr. Manager, Patient Engagement and Recruitment
Job Description:
Job Description

Working with Us
Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You’ll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.

We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .

Position Summary

This individual contributor role has task-level responsibility for development and implementation of disease-specific patient engagement and recruitment strategies that focus on creating a positive site and patient experience in BMS clinical trials.  Will serve as a key member of clinical trial teams, partnering with various internal and external stakeholders to support, raise awareness of and promote access to clinical trials in a variety of indications to drive and accelerate clinical trial recruitment for BMS.

Key Responsibilities

  • Responsible for building and implementing indication/protocol level patient engagement and recruitment strategies which utilize tactics including, but not limited to, connectivity with patients/advocacy groups, enhanced digital capabilities, and/or other patient service offerings which optimize the site/patient experience and trial recruitment timelines.
  • E2E accountability for clinical trial acceleration using patient recruitment strategies.
  • Accountable for the implementation of selected tactics at the indication/protocol level and ensures timely delivery of creative materials, digital/media plans, and other tactics in alignment with the overall plan.
  • Actively engages with indication/protocol level stakeholders within Global Development Operations (OPLs/GTMs, CTM/CTMos, and other colleagues), BI&A and the broader clinical trial team regarding recruitment timelines, tactics and site/patient insights; continuously communicates status updates to team leadership.
  • Drives innovation for engagement and recruitment in clinical trials through awareness of external environment, focus on keeping patients and caregivers at the center while striving to be the site’s preferred sponsor
  • Partners with enterprise colleagues (omnichannel hub, global procurement, etc.) to identify new opportunities which further enhance our engagement and/or recruitment toolkit.
  • Contributes to the development of TA/indication specific digital health and innovation strategy.
  • Serves as an advocate for inclusion of a focus on diverse recruitment as part of strategy development. Partners with development and operations study leaders on the diversity strategy and actively contributes to the indication/protocol-specific diversity plan.
  • Partners with enterprise colleagues on the development/maintenance of strong relationships with site and patient organizations to gain insight into their clinical trial experience and better inform our development and recruitment efforts.  Collaborates with these organizations around awareness of and access to clinical trials and the drug development process
  • Synthesize analytic data to take action and support trial recruitment delivery. Leverage data to determine the effectiveness of tactics utilized. Communicate critical findings to leadership in a timely manner and make recommendations for ongoing efforts.
  • Manage engagement and recruitment budget, balancing strategy with key deliverables and leveraging input and guidance from the broader matrix team.
  • Contribute to the ongoing development, maintenance and enhancement of BMS Study Connect by seeking ways to leverage it as a communication platform to drive awareness of and access to BMS Clinical Trials.
  • Other duties as assigned to support Clinical Trial recruitment.


Qualifications & Experience

  • Minimum of a BA or BS Degree in Legal, Life Science, Business Administration or equivalent.  Advanced degree a plus.
  • Sr. Manager: Clinical development experience of 3 to 5 years of relevant industry experience (pharma, biotech, CRO) required
  • Manager: Clinical development experience of 1 to 3 years of relevant industry experience (pharma, biotech, CRO) required
  • Advanced knowledge of patient engagement and recruitment strategies and approaches, ICH / GCP and regulatory guidelines/directives, understanding of drug development process and Pharma, Strong organizational, time-management, analytical and decision-making skills in order to efficiently evaluate, plan and accomplish work goals
  • Excellent Computer skills - MS office suite, Sharepoint, etc. CTMS (Veeva experience preferred, knowledge of portals, databases and other Clinical Trial enabling technologies
  • Proven experience in managing key internal and external stakeholders effectively by frequently soliciting input and gathering and incorporating feedback into processes as appropriate
  • Effective management of cross-functional, multi-cultural teams and demonstrated ability to work and influence within a matrix structure
  • Proven time management skills and ability to be flexible to meet job demands, manage multiple priorities and take on new initiatives and improvement efforts
  • Demonstrates a high level of adaptability in dealing with ambiguous and complex work environment and balances multiple demands on role in a responsive and professional manner.
  • Ability to sustain high levels of performance in a constantly changing environment.

This individual contributor role has accountability for outsourcing management within a specific therapeutic area(s) and is accountable to manage clinical trial vendor partnerships that supports alliance and outsourcing management across multiple service categories of clinical trial activities in R&D.

Key Responsibilities

  • Serve as primary or escalation trial-level point of contact for outsourcing: facilitating vendor selection, managing SOWs, overseeing vendor performance and managing vendor budget accountability

  • Provide oversight to or drive outsourcing activities including interfacing with operational teams, support groups and service providers for successful selection, contracting and execution of outsourced studies while ensuring compliance with regulatory standards, ethical practices, BMS outsourcing and procurement policies and procedures

  • Provide operational expertise and strategic leadership, support, guidance and training to study teams on all aspects of outsourced work and ensure alignment to related BMS outsourcing strategies

  • Develop subject-matter expertise in one or multiple categories of outsourced spend (e.g., CRO/FSP, central labs/specialty labs, technology) and serve as a resource to OM colleagues for that category

  • Oversee relationships with vendors in support of the Director of Outsourcing and serve as point of contact for vendor-related issues

  • Ensures timely and high-quality provision of external services to all BMS clinical trials

  • Ensures vendor commitments and timelines are met ensuring fulfillment of vendor obligations to BMS across all GDO categories including FSP

  • Ensure vendor financial and resource accountability to contract

  • Ensure alignment with other matrix partners such as Global Procurement, as it pertains to outsourced study execution, procedures, processes and vendor interactions.

  • Research best practices across a variety of industries and disciplines and translates into relevant actions for improvements within BMS.

Qualifications & Experience

  • Minimum of a BA or BS Degree in a clinical or scientific discipline (advanced degree a plus).

  • Clinical development experience of 5-7 years of relevant industry experience (pharma, biotech, CRO) required

  • Scientific, Financial, and business problem-solving experience desired

  • Experience with clinical service providers: initiating, negotiating and executing legal and/or financial agreements in the clinical trials environment- biotech or pharmaceutical industry.

  • Proven experience in managing key internal and external stakeholders (including senior leaders) effectively by frequently soliciting input and gathering and incorporating feedback into processes and driving change as appropriate.

  • Demonstrated understanding of the needs of stakeholders with ability to build and maintain relationships

  • Effective management of cross-functional, multi-cultural teams and demonstrated ability to work and influence within a matrix structure.

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills and diplomacy to convey information and influence others with a strong customer focus.

  • Demonstrates a high level of adaptability in dealing with ambiguous and complex work environment and balances multiple demands on role in a responsive and professional manner.

Job Title : Transplant Account Manager

Summary:

BMS currently has an exciting specialty position available for a Transplant Account Manager. You will be responsible for optimizing access and appropriate utilization through account management at key transplant centers and consolidated group practices, and as well as elevating BMS as a leader within the Transplant space. This is an important asset in the BMS immunology portfolio and has untapped market potential as the only biologic therapy for anti-rejection in kidney transplant.

The Transplant Account Manager will work with a broad internal cross-matrix team, including Medical, HEOR, Regional Marketing, and Marketing. This is a critical role in establishing BMS as a leader in Transplant and identifying opportunities for relevant, compliant collaborations with these key accounts. This is a field-based role that reports directly into Marketing, Established Brands. Ability for up to 75% travel including overnights is required.


Responsibilities:

  • Gain a deep understanding of customer objectives, challenges and market dynamics and translate this knowledge into developing actionable strategic plans to optimize customer engagement and account outcomes.

  • Integrate and prioritize account plans and activities across matrix partners to ensure stellar account management/support that leads to meaningful outcomes.

  • Engage and partner with key customers to implement compliant solutions to optimize patient care (customers include, but are not limited to, key decision makers and stakeholders at transplant centers of excellence, large and independent consolidated groups)

  • Identify unique, meaningful opportunities to differentiate both BMS and its products within key accounts.

  • Lead internal business strategy and planning reviews across matrix partners, including but not limited to Regional Marketing, Medical, and HEOR, on ongoing basis to ensure seamless execution against account plans.

  • Serve as the lead BMS contact for pharmacy and operations key decision makers within targeted accounts.

  • Analyze and apply market data to assess business opportunities and priorities, including relevant impact of regional healthcare trends.

  • Coordinate internal and field resources and facilitate senior executive interactions as appropriate.

  • Region / geographic location – West


Qualifications:

  • BS/BA degree required.

  • Minimum of 7 years of pharmaceutical experience

  • Prior experience in Solid Organ Transplant and/or an Advanced Medical degree is strongly preferred.

  • Recent transplant experience is strongly preferred.

  • Proven leadership skills and ability to network across complex internal and external environment.

  • Demonstrates critical thinking and strong decision-making skills.

  • Excellent social, communication (oral and written) and presentation skills required.

  • Ability to navigate complex accounts and engage with diverse stakeholders.

  • Demonstrated ability to develop innovative customer centric approaches, leverage multi-disciplinary capabilities and resources to realize objectives.

Position: Associate Director, Global Cell Therapy, Strategy & Operations

Location : Princeton Pike or Summit, New Jersey

At Bristol Myers Squibb we are reimagining the future of cell therapy . With our bold ambition, backed by a best-in-the-industry team and long-term commitment, we are leading the way to unlock the full promise of cell therapy as we strive to put more patients on the path to a cure. If you are ready to challenge yourself, accelerate your career, and give new hope to patients, there’s no better place than here at BMS with our Cell Therapy team.

The Associate Director, Global Cell Therapy Organization (CTO), Strategy & Operations (US Performance) will report to and act as a critical partner to the Global CTO Senior Director S&O (CTO S&O Senior Director, CTO and US performance). The Associate Director will be responsible for driving performance of the US and worldwide CTO teams by developing and designing key execution metrics and aligning expectations for pull-through with the US Leadership Team, global Cell Therapy Leadership Team (CTLT) and other functional stakeholders. The individual will identify and pull through US-specific execution improvement opportunities for immediate impact. The role will also support the CTO S&O Senior Director in building external CTO presence including executive account visits and congresses to ensure exceptional customer experience and commercial impact. In addition, the incumbent will support the CTO S&O Senior Director to own management of the Quarterly Earnings readiness process and preparing CTLT members for engagements with investors and analysts.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Key partner to the CTO S&O Sr Dir in developing a clear framework, systems and tools to build a performance-centric culture to achieve superior results across WW and US CTO
  • Actively involved under supervision of CTO S&O Sr Dir in establishing a disciplined approach to setting, executing, and measuring success against commercial priorities while designing and implementing systems and tools to track performance at a fast-pace cadence
  • Consolidate US key metrics in dynamic dashboard, identify US performance executional gaps or hurdles against agreed-upon priorities and provide timely analysis reports
  • Consolidate US performance input into business reviews process for CTO President and BMS CCO monthly business reviews
  • Consolidate US CT input with collaboration of US and WW cross-functional teams into development of BMS quarterly earning call and Investor Relations events documentation
  • Support Sr Director in overseeing planning and execution of US POAs
  • Own coordination and readiness for executive account visits and CT involvement in priority global congresses
  • Identify areas of synergy, best practice, and opportunity for improvement to manage and track performance across US operations

Qualifications & Experience:

  • BA/BS required. MBA, or other graduate degree strongly preferred
  • 5-8 years combined commercial experience across related disciplines, Global and/or local Marketing, BI&A, or strategic management consulting experiences
  • Deep understanding of US bio-pharma commercial market and dynamics required
  • Relevant experience in Cell Therapy is preferable
  • Demonstrated strong ability to combine strategic thinking skills and commercial operational acumen to identify strategic and/or operational opportunities to drive performance for superior results
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and design, manage or implement multiple projects simultaneously
  • Results driven, with excellent organizational, analytical, and planning skills
  • Concise and impactful oral & written communication skills
  • Ability to work with cross-functional, matrixed teams, maintaining strong relationships and influencing outcomes

Why You Should Apply

Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.
